Curiosity IO
  • alignmentThe positioning of text within the page margins. Alignment can be flush left, flush right, justified, or centered. Flush left and flush right are sometimes referred to as left justified and right justified.
  • ascenderThe part of lowercase letters (such as k, b, and d) that ascends above the x-height of the other lowercase letters in a face.
  • centeredText placed at an equal distance from the left and right margins. Headlines are often centered. It is generally not good to mix centered text with flush left or flush right text.
